法規內容.條文內容: This Standard is set forth pursuant to Paragraph 2, Article 21 of the Statute for the Establishment and Administration of Export Processing Zone (hereinafter referred to as this Statute).

Businesses in the EPZ as prescribed in Paragraph 2, Article 3 of this Statute are categorized as follows in respect of the calculation of their administration fees:
1. Businesses in the EPZ are categorized according to the Republic of China’s industrial classification standard.  Those belonging to the manufacturing industry are charged according to the manufacturing industry rate; those belonging to the wholesale and retail industry are charged according to the trading industry rate; those belonging to the transportation and warehousing industry are charged according to the warehousing and transportation industry rate; those belonging to the professional, scientific and technical service industries are charged according to the service industry rate; and those belonging to the financial and insurance industries are charged according to the financial and insurance industry rate.
2. Carriers recognized by the Export Processing Zone Administration (hereinafter referred to as the Administration), Ministry of Economic Affairs.
3. Public or private enterprises having obtained approval to invest in and construct, lease or sell a building in the EPZ.
4. Other businesses with a sales or contact office in the EPZ, apart from carriers and public or private enterprises having obtained approval to invest in and construct, lease or sell a building in the EPZ.
5. For the businesses set forth in Subparagraph 1 which concurrently operate retail business or the businesses mentioned in the preceding subparagraph which engage in retail business, the charge standard specified in Article 10-1 applies to their retail business.

Administration fees for businesses in the Kaohsiung Software Park are calculated based on the floor area of the building, and charged according to the following regressive rates, with the exception of the businesses set forth in Subparagraph 3 of the preceding article:
1. For a floor area not exceeding 2,500 square meters, NT$8 is charged per square meter on a monthly basis.
2. For a floor area over 2,500 square meters and not exceeding 5,000 square meters, NT$7.5 is charged per square meter for the additional areas on a monthly basis.
3. For a floor area over 5,000 square meters and not exceeding 10,000 square meters, NT$7 is charged per square meter for the additional areas on a monthly basis.
4. For a floor area over 10,000 square meters, NT$6.5 is charged per square meter for the additional areas on a monthly basis.

Administration fees for businesses in the EPZ with an operational site located in the Taichung Software Park are charged based on the sales turnover, and according to the rates applicable to their businesses as specified in Articles 6 to 10-1, with the exception of the businesses set forth in Subparagraph 2 or 3 of Article 2.  For businesses not mentioned in Articles 6 to 10-1, 1.8/1,000 is charged on the sales turnover.
In the case where businesses in the EPZ have an operational site in the Second District of Nanzih Export Processing Zone,  administration fees are charged based on the sales turnover, and according to the rates applicable to their businesses as specified in Articles 5 to 10-1.
In the event where the monthly administration fees mentioned in the preceding two paragraphs are insufficient for the rate of NT$8 per square meter based on the floor area of the building, NT$8 is charged per square meter based on the floor area of the building.
Administration fees for businesses in the EPZ with some of their operations carried out in the Second District of Nanzih Export Processing Zone or Taichung Software Park and other operations performed in other parks, are calculated separately based on the respective sales turnover amounts and charge standards specified by the zones/parks where they operate, and collected on a consolidated basis.  However, if the annual combined sales turnover of a manufacturing or trading business that operates in different zones/parks is eligible for a regressive rate, the regressive rate may apply to its combined sales turnover.
In the event where the current sales turnover declared pursuant to the aforesaid proviso involves different rate brackets due to regression, the sales turnover generated in the operational site with a later establishment approval date shall be first included in the amount exceeding the applicable range of the regressive rate.

Sales turnover mentioned in this Standard includes sales income, service income, commission income, project income, processing income, rental income, transfers of commodities or labor service of businesses in the EPZ with their head office or branch office, and other items attributable to operating income.

Administration fees for the manufacturing industry are charged on a monthly basis according to the following regressive rates based on the annual sales turnover (from January 1 to December 31 every year; the same below); NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.
1. For an annual sales turnover below NT$10 billion, 2.2/1,000 is charged.
2. For the amount exceeding NT$10 billion up to NT$20 billion, 1.9/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.
3. For the amount exceeding NT$20 billion, 0.8/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.

Administration fees for the trading industry that delivers goods to the EPZ are charged on a monthly basis according to the following regressive rates based on the annual sales turnover; NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.
1. For an annual sales turnover below NT$1 billion, 1.3/1,000 is charged.
2. For the amount exceeding NT$1 billion up to NT$4 billion, 1.1/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.
3. For the amount exceeding NT$4 billion up to NT$10 billion, 0.9/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.
4. For the amount exceeding NT$10 billion up to NT$20 billion, 0.7/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.
5. For the amount exceeding NT$20 billion up to NT$30 billion, 0.5/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.
6. For the amount exceeding NT$30 billion, 0.3/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.

Administration fees for the trading industry that does not deliver goods to the EPZ are charged on a monthly basis according to the following regressive rates based on the annual sales turnover; NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.
1. For an annual sales turnover below NT$5 billion, 0.4/1,000 is charged.
2. For the amount exceeding NT$5 billion up to NT$15 billion, 0.3/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.
3. For the amount exceeding NT$15 billion up to NT$25 billion, 0.2/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.
4. For the amount exceeding NT$25 billion, 0.1/1,000 is charged on the exceeding turnover.
For warehousing and transportation industry, an administration fee of 2/1,000 of the sales turnover is charged; NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.
For service industries, an administration fee of 1.8/1,000 is charged on the sales turnover; NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.
For financial and insurance industries, an administration fee of 0.9/1,000 is charged on the sales turnover; NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.

For industries permitted to engage in retail business, an administration fee is charged at 3/1,000 of the retail turnover.  In the event where the monthly administration fee is insufficient for the rate of NT$8 per square meter based on the floor area of the building occupied for the retail business, NT$8 is charged per square meter based on the floor area of the building.
Administration fees for those permitted to engage in retail business prior to May 1, 2014 and subject to Article 3 or 13 shall be charged according to the respectively applicable charge standards.

For carriers recognized by the Administration, administration fees are charged on the basis of the number of their registered vehicles.  The rate is NT$300 per month per vehicle for tractors, and NT$200 per month per vehicle for bonded and general trucks.  The calculation is based on the combined number of vehicles.  NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.

For public and private enterprises having obtained approval to invest in and construct, lease or sell a building in the EPZ pursuant to this Statute, an administration fee of 1.5/1,000 is charged on the sales turnover of the constructed, leased or sold building; NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.

For businesses other than those set forth in Subparagraphs 2 and 3 of Article 2, with a sales or contact office in the EPZ, and whose rented or usage area is less than 800 square meters, an administration fee of NT$25 per month per square meter is charged, but NT$900 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$900; for those occupying an area more than 800 square meters, NT$20 per month per square meter is charged for the exceeding area.

In regard to the businesses having obtained approval to provide dining or accommodation services in the EPZ through open tendering procedures carried out by the Administration or the Branch, the administration fees are charged based on the amount specified in the tender documentation by the Administration or the Branch.

Land inside the EPZ shall be developed by the landowner pursuant to the provision in Subparagraph 3, Paragraph 1, Article 11 of this Statute prior to its amendment on May 30, 2006.  For landowners who maintain their public facilities inside the EPZ, the monthly administration fees of their businesses in the EPZ shall be halved the industry’s standard as listed in Article 5 through Article 10; NT$1,000 is charged for a calculated monthly amount less than NT$1,000.

Businesses in the EPZ shall pay administration fees starting from the month following the approval of their operation; businesses with a sales or contact office in the EPZ shall pay administration fees starting from the month following the approval of their set-up.
In the event where administration fees are charged pursuant to Article 3, Paragraph 3 of Article 3-1, Paragraph 1 of Article 10-1, and Article 13, the area of newly established facilities shall be included in the calculation of the floor area of the building starting from the month following the changes in factory registration; the area of operational sites apart from newly established facilities shall be included in the calculation of the floor area of the building starting from the month following the acquisition of a use permit, changes in building ownership, or effective date of a lease.

Businesses in the EPZ that are subject to an administration fee charged based on their sales turnover shall fill out a sales turnover and administration fee declaration form for businesses in the EPZ before the 20th day of the month following the end of each payment period, and the following documents shall be attached.  Sales turnover and administration fees shall be declared to the Administration or the Branch, and the administration fees shall be paid before the last day of the month following the payment period:
1. Photocopy of the operator’s sales and tax declaration submitted to the revenue service office for the current period.  But this may be waived for those unable to get the operator’s sales and tax declaration.
2. Details of the receipts.  But this may be waived for those who have listed the amount clearly in the operator’s sales and tax declaration.
3. Photocopy of the documents certifying the fulfillment of the withholding items.  But this may be waived for sales returns and discounted disposal, and income from the sales of fixed assets outside the scope of business, of which the amount has been clearly listed in the declaration.
4. Other certificates and documents required by the Administration or the Branch for the need to review declared materials.
Transfers of commodities and labor service by businesses in the EPZ with their head office or branch office should be attached in another detailed report or other relevant documents.
Electronic documents may be used for the declaration of the sales turnover and administration fees in the foregoing two paragraphs.
Other businesses with a sales or contact office in the EPZ, apart from public and private enterprises having obtained approval to invest in and construct, lease or sell a building in the EPZ, shall pay administration fees before the last day of the month following the end of each payment period.

In case of mistakes in the declaration of industrial classification, businesses in the EPZ shall apply to the Administration or the Branch for modification with certificates issued by certified public accountants or other documents or materials that may serve as proof prior to the closing of the last payment period (end of next January) of the current year. Delayed applications will not be accepted.
In the event of changes in the amount of administration fees resulting from changes of industrial classification, adjustments may be made in the sales turnover declared in the current year, and additional administration fees shall be paid or refunded after the closing of the last payment period of the current year.

Businesses in the EPZ may stop paying the administration fees from the month when the company dismissal registration, revocation or annulment of company registration, or removal from the EPZ is approved or when all of the land and factory lease agreements are terminated.
Businesses with a sales or contact office in the EPZ may stop paying the administration fees from the month when they wind up the office in the EPZ, when their business registration in the EPZ is revoked or annulled, or when the land and building lease agreements are terminated.
Businesses operating in the EPZ which record zero sales turnover due to force majeure, cessation of operation or a full stand-down may apply to the Administration or the Branch for waiver of administration fees by attaching the relevant documents.  However, no refund of the already paid administration fees will be made.
The waiver of administration fees in the foregoing paragraph should be canceled, and payment of administration fees should resume immediately from the month of resumption of operation, resumption of work or when it begins to have record of sales.

Sales returns and discounted disposal, payments or receipts on behalf of others, mistaken invoices, income from the sales of fixed assets outside the scope of business, income from scraps and residues, rental income within six months and rental income from assets outside the EPZ included in the sales turnover declared by businesses in the EPZ may be excluded from the calculation of administration fees if sufficient supporting document is attached.
For payments or receipts on behalf of others included in the sales turnover mentioned in the foregoing paragraph, exemption should be processed in each payment period.  At the end of a year when the company prepares the final accounts and makes declaration, the amount as appeared in the CPA-verified annual final accounts should be submitted to the Administration or the Branch for future reference.  At the same time, application for supplemental payment or refund of administration fees should be made to the Administration or the Branch with the verified amount as audited by the accountant.

In case of one of the following situations, sales turnover declared by businesses in the EPZ may be excluded from the calculation of administration fees:
1. The part of purchases of goods made at the head office, branch office or affiliated companies in the EPZ.
2. The part of commissioned processing entrusted to the head office, branch office or affiliated companies in the EPZ.
Exemption of the aforesaid exclusions from the calculation of administration fees should be processed in each payment period.  At the end of a year when the company prepares the final accounts and makes declaration, the amount as appeared in the CPA-verified annual final accounts should be submitted to the Administration or the Branch for future reference.  At the same time, application for supplemental payment or refund of administration fees should be made to the Administration or the Branch with the verified amount as audited by the accountant.

The charging standard of procedural fees is as follows:
1. Procedural fee for permission and registration of factory’s establishment: various fees are charged according to the charge standards for applying for permission and registration of factory’s establishment.
2. Procedural fee for chattel-loan transaction registration: various fees are charged pursuant to the Enforcement Rules of the Personal Property Secured Transactions Act.
3. Fee for electrician registration: according to the electricity industry’s charging standard.
4. Construction or miscellaneous license fee: on the basis of 1/1,000 of the construction price of the building
5. Fee for issuance of country of origin certificate: according to the Regulation on the Administration of Country of Origin Certificate.
6. Fee for application of permit to erect billboard advertisement: for those fixed on the wall of a building covering an area less than 1.2 square meter, NT$100 per incident; for those covering an area greater than 1.2 square meter, NT$1,000 per incident.
7. Fee for sales or contact office registration certificate: NT$200 per incident
8. Auditing fee for new or altered business waste disposal proposal: according to the charging standard of auditing fee for business waste disposal proposal
9. Auditing fee or certificate fee for application of issuance, replacement or re-issuance of permit for the installation, alteration or operation of fixed pollution source: certificate fee is charged according to the auditing fee and certificate fee charging standard of permit for the installation, alteration and operation of fixed pollution source.
10. Procedural fee for company registration: relevant fees are charged pursuant to the Regulations Governing Collection of Company Registration Fees.

Items and charging standard of service fees are as follows:
1. Fee for providing certification service outside office hours: NT$200 per hour, for at least one hour even if less than one hour is spent; there is a minimum charge for four hours on holiday.
2. Other approved items of service fees: paperwork charge for entry/exit permit, parking fee, short-term venue maintenance fee, long-term venue maintenance fee, medical insurance fee, industrial water supply maintenance fee, sewage system usage fee, and other service fees are charged according to the standard approved by the Ministry of Economic Affairs.
All fees stipulated in this Standard shall be paid within the deadline as listed on the respective payment slips.
Collection of all fees stipulated in this Standard shall be processed according to the budgeting procedure.

This standard came into force on February 1, 2011.
The amendment to this standard came into force on May 1, 2014.
